subject: Physical Fitness
title: Type II Fibers: The Power Engine
description: A micro-lesson that makes Type II Fibers: The Power Engine usable.

hook.text: A cat pounces. A basketball player dunks. Explosive movements demand fibers built for raw speed.

buildup.text: Type II fibers are larger, contract faster, and generate much more force than Type I fibers.

discovery.text: They rely on stored ATP and glycolysis â€” no oxygen needed. Fast energy, but limited supply.

twist.text: Type II fibers fatigue in seconds to minutes. They're sprinters, not marathoners.

climax.text: They subdivide into IIa (moderate endurance) and IIx (pure speed). Training can shift IIx toward IIa.

punchline.text: Type II fibers are your power reserve. Fast, fierce, and first to tire.

quiz.question: How do Type II fibers primarily generate energy?
